titles.title: Worker Eligibility Fairness Act of 2011
To amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to remove the ineligibility of individuals who participate in a strike.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Nutrition and Horticulture .

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary: 2/8/2011--Introduced. Worker Eligibility Fairness Act of 2011 - Amends the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to eliminate the provision making a federal, state, or local government employee who is dismissed for participating in a strike against the federal government, the state, or a political subdivision of the state ineligible for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP, formerly food stamps).
